docs.snippet: THE final day of Fashion Week felt a bit like a dash for the last plane out of Lisbon, if you know what I mean. Everyone wore very tight expressions. The journalists heading to London were already in the transit lounge. Still, the day's shows held...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE final day of Fashion Week felt a bit like a dash for the last plane out of Lisbon, if you know what I mean. Everyone wore very tight expressions. The journalists heading to London were already in the transit lounge. Still, the day's shows held some delights: Ralph Lauren's beautifully rendered Deco glamour and subplot of a Chinese retail assault; L'Wren Scott's Gauguin colors and a pitch, from both Ms. Scott and Francisco Costa of Calvin Klein, for short hemlines. Skirt lengths have generally been below the knees or to the ankles. To me, the most striking change this season was the amount of innovative fabrics and embellishment, whether it was Oscar de la Renta's Oriental embroidery and patchwork or Marc Jacobs's rubber skirts crafted to look sequined.
docs.abstract: Cathy Horyn On The Runway column notes that most striking change seen at New York Fashion Week is amount of innovative fabrics and embellishments used by designers; photos (M)

docs.snippet: Tweeting Since April 2009Followers 57, 545Twitter Bio Actress, author, personality, singer     Sandra Bernhard's Twitter-worthy notions start out a lot like anyone else's. ''I'll be walking down the street,'' she said, ''and I see something or a f...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tweeting Since April 2009Followers 57, 545Twitter Bio Actress, author, personality, singer Sandra Bernhard's Twitter-worthy notions start out a lot like anyone else's. ''I'll be walking down the street,'' she said, ''and I see something or a funny idea pops into my head.'' But instead of composing a message on the spot, she performs a ritual of social-media restraint, she said: ''I keep repeating it, then I run home and send it out!''
docs.abstract: Sampling of recent Twitter posts by actress and author Sandra Bernhard; photo (M)

docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (NBC) SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE BACKSTAGE Behind-the-scenes glimpses, like a set sketch, above, chronicle the history of ''Saturday Night Live,'' including how the show began in 1975. Interviews feature some of the stars, writers, hosts and music...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (NBC) SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE BACKSTAGE Behind-the-scenes glimpses, like a set sketch, above, chronicle the history of ''Saturday Night Live,'' including how the show began in 1975. Interviews feature some of the stars, writers, hosts and musical guests -- among them, Alec Baldwin, Drew Barrymore, Jeff Bridges, Albert Brooks, James Franco, Buck Henry, Sarah Palin, Joe Piscopo, Taylor Swift, Justin Timberlake and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs. 9 A.M. (CNN) STATE OF THE UNION WITH CANDY CROWLEY Senators Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of New York, and Richard G. Lugar, Republican of Indiana, discuss President Obama's proposed 2012 budget and potential bipartisan solutions to the nation's fiscal problems. There's more on that subject with Senators Tom Coburn, Republican of Oklahoma, and Claire McCaskill, Democrat of Missouri, on ''Fox News Sunday With Chris Wallace,'' at 10; with Representatives Paul D. Ryan, Republican of Wisconsin, and Chris Van Hollen, Democrat of Maryland, on ''Face the Nation,'' at 10:30 on CBS; and with Senators Richard J. Durbin, Democrat of Illinois, and Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, on ''Meet the Press,'' at 10:30 on NBC.
